prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: Requested sensitivity: Since the masses of the mm-wave cores are in the range between 0.054 - 0.14 MSun, I propose the sensitivity of 0.01 MSun beam-1 for 3-mm continuum observations to detect them by at least 4 times of rms noise level, which is a criterion of core identification in Kamazaki et al. (2001). Considering typical temperatures of ~10 K and dust opacity index of 2 at pre-protostellar cores (e.g. Ward-Thompson et al. 1994), the required sensitivity for it is 0.2 mJy beam-1. The spatial resolution of 3 arcseconds would be enough to separate mm-wave cores with each other, because the distances to the targets are less than 200 pc and expected size is about 500 AU. The peak intensity and line width of N2H+ are ~2 K and ~0.5 km s-1 with 26"-beam, respectively, at the representative PPC, L1544 (Tafalla et al. 1998). Since signal-to-noise ratio (S/N) higher than 6 is required toward the peak intensity in order to achieve S/N3 at its half-power, the required sensitivity is 0.33 K at the velocity resolution of 0.1 km s-1. which is the highest frequency resolution in dual polarization mode. Field setup: 7-field mosaicing observations (1 center field + surrounding 6 fields) with both of 12-m Array and ACA 7-m Array are proposed to cover most of the area of each target, because target sizes are between 0.04 pc and 0.13 pc as shown in Table 1. Correlator setup: 3-mm continuum and N2H+ line observations are proposed. One baseband pair is allocated to N2H+ line and the remaining three baseband pairs are for 3-mm continuum.

Requested sensitivity: Since the masses of the mm-wave cores are in the range between 0.054 - 0.14 MSun, I propose the sensitivity of 0.01 MSun beam-1 for 3-mm continuum observations to detect them by at least 4 times of rms noise level, which is a criterion of core identification in Kamazaki et al. (2001). Considering typical temperatures of ~10 K and dust opacity index of 2 at pre-protostellar cores (e.g. Ward-Thompson et al. 1994), the required sensitivity for it is 0.2 mJy beam-1. The spatial resolution of 3 arcseconds would be enough to separate mm-wave cores with each other, because the distances to the targets are less than 200 pc and expected size is about 500 AU. Field setup: 7-field mosaicing observations (1 center field + surrounding 6 fields) with both of 12-m Array and ACA 7-m Array are proposed to cover most of the area of each target, because target sizes are between 0.04 pc and 0.13 pc as shown in Table 1. Correlator setup: 3-mm continuum and N2H+ line observations are proposed. One baseband pair is allocated to N2H+ line and the remaining three baseband pairs are for 3-mm continuum.

(2001). Considering typical temperatures of ~10 K and dust opacity index of 2 at pre-protostellar cores (e.g. Ward-Thompson et al. 1994), the required sensitivity for it is 0.2 mJy beam-1. The spatial resolution of 3 arcseconds would be enough to separate mm-wave cores with each other, because the distances to the targets are less than 200 pc and expected size is about 500 AU. Correlator setup: 3-mm continuum and N2H+ line observations are proposed. One baseband pair is allocated to N2H+ line and the remaining three baseband pairs are for 3-mm continuum.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: My past observations revealed 1,000 AU scale structures of the submillimeter sources, which are considered to be in pre-protostellar phase, in the rho Ophiuchi A star forming region. In this result, the sources are not simple cores like a sphere whose density distribution is represented by power-law, but consist of multiple smaller-scale cores of 600 - 1,100 AU. This is a different image about pre-protostellar core from what we have so far. Thus, I propose 3 mm continuum and N2H+ (1-0) line observations toward other millimeter/submillimeter sources in order to search for such smaller-scale cores and study possible start-formation through coalescence of them.

prp:PrincipalInvestigator.prp:organisation: ALMA Project Office, National Astronomical Observatory of Japan
